meanings.definition: A device used to introduce a fluid into a system by means of a high-velocity jet.
meanings.sent1: The eductors in the water treatment plant help mix chemicals efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic installed new eductors in the irrigation system.
meanings.sent3: The eductors in the pool seemed to have a secret dance party at night.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted like eductors, injecting new ideas into the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The eductors roared like dragons, spewing liquid into the pipes.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that educates or instructs.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was the eductors who guided students through their lessons.
meanings.sent2: Books are great eductors, teaching us new things every day.
meanings.sent3: The eductors, like wise owls, shared their knowledge with the group.
meanings.sent4: Life experiences can be powerful eductors, shaping our understanding of the world.
meanings.sent5: The eductors' words were like seeds, planting ideas in young minds.
